screenplay.rawText:
EXT. OUTSIDE JASON’S ART STUDIO – DAY
Jason arrives at his studio and immediately notices that someone has once again scattered trash all over the area by his dumpster. He becomes angry and vents his frustration on camera.
actions: Jason drives into the parking lot.
He gets out of his truck visibly irritated.
Jason spots trash scattered everywhere near the dumpster.
The camera pans to the mess on the ground.

narrative.summary: Jason arrives for Day Three of painting and once again finds trash spread across his parking lot. His growing frustration hints at external pressures beyond the commission itself.
narrative.beatPurpose: Escalate Jason’s environmental stress; reinforce a recurring annoyance that may later become thematically or plot-relevant.
narrative.conflict: Jason vs. whoever keeps rummaging through his trash; Jason vs. mounting stress.
narrative.stakes: Mental fatigue is accumulating — a subtle threat to both his timeline and emotional stability.
narrative.outcome: Jason is angered, and the tension surrounding the trash continues to rise.

revealedBackstory: The trash scavenging problem is persistent over multiple days.

locations: Parking lot outside Jason’s Art Studio
continuityLinks: This reinforces the ongoing trash problem from SC-004.
The day-by-day progression toward the painting deadline continues.

music: Short tension sting or comedic frustration cue
cameraIdeas: Follow Jason out of the truck with a handheld shot.
Pan to the trash in a reveal moment.
Medium close-up on Jason for emotional emphasis.
